text: Also check out the RASTER package on the R-Forge website:
It is not released to CRAN yet but it is an excellent package to import, analyse, extract, subset images and convert them to matrices).
You can download the package in R via:

code:
#from file
r <- raster(system.file("external/test.grd", package="raster"))
logo <- raster(system.file("external/rlogo.grd", package="raster"), values=TRUE) 
plot(logo)
?raster # and go to index of the package for an overview of all the options for image analysis.

text: I'd start with EBImage - check out the vignette which demonstrates many of the tasks you mention.
You may also be interested in Rpy which allows you to call R functions and use R packages from Python.
This may allow you to have your cake (Python's imaging libraries) and eat it too (R's statistical analysis capabilities).
You will be able to read (import) and write (export) GeoTiff image files from/to R.
I believe the CRAN Task View on Medical Imaging should have something for you.
